comments:
Inspected a Event (SWT.SetData), then in the inspect popup did CTRL-A, then * (expand all) a bunch of times, waited for awhile, then clicked somewhere else to get rid of the popup and my error logged filled up with these.
This is probably not likely to happen to sane people, but it might be worth a null check anyway. Always seems bad when 20-30 errors occur at once. :-)

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.TreeModelContentProvider.getPresentationContext(TreeModelContentProvider.java:92)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.ViewerUpdateMonitor.getPresentationContext(ViewerUpdateMonitor.java:158)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementContentProvider.retrieveChildren(ElementContentProvider.java:83)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementContentProvider$1.run(ElementContentProvider.java:41)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Fixed in ViewerUpdateMonitor and LabelUpdate by caching the presentation context in the request. This way we don't have to retrieve it from a potentially null viewer in the content provider. Also cleared all waiting requests from content provider when it is disposed.
